sections.heading: for irrigation purposes; Legislature; finding

46-636.Pumping for irrigation purposes; Legislature; finding.

The Legislature finds that the pumping of water for irrigation purposes from water wells located within fifty feet of the bank of a channel of any natural stream may have a direct effect on the surface flow of such stream.

SourceLaws 1963, c. 275, ยง 1, p. 828;Laws 1993, LB 131, ยง 16;Laws 2001, LB 667, ยง 7.

Cross ReferencesFor additional definitions, see section 46-706.
